sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"忍受"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: stand, bear, endure, tolerate, suffer, abide, withstand
means: stand ： 口语用词，常可与bear换用，但前者侧重指经受得起，后者强调容忍，是普通用语。
endure ： 书面用词，指长时间忍受痛苦和不幸，着重体力或意志力的坚强不屈服。
tolerate ： 指以自我克制的态度，对待令人反感或厌恶的东西，含默认宽容意味。
suffer ： 通常指非自愿或被迫忍受各种痛苦、困难或不快，强调受到苦难。
abide ： 指忍受长期的痛苦或折磨，强调耐心和屈从。多用于否定句和疑问句中。
withstand ： 指因具有一定实力、权力或能力而能忍受某种情况。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  beran, of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit bharati, Greek pherein, and Latin ferre
Old English  bera, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch beer and German Bär

encyclopedia.content: 生物学 意思：熊 拼音：xiong 界： 动物界 Animalia 门： 脊索动物门 Chordata 纲： 哺乳纲 Mammalia 目： 食肉目 Carnivora 科： 熊科 Ursidae （G. Fischer de Waldheim, 1817 ） 属： 大熊猫属 Ailuropoda 马来熊属 Helarctos 懒熊属 Melursus 熊属 Ursus 眼镜熊属 Tremarctos 熊齿兽属 Arctodus（已灭绝） 亚科： ●猫熊亚科 Ailuropodinae 大猫熊 Ailuropoda melanoleuca ●眼镜熊亚科 Tremarctinae 眼镜熊 Tremarctos ornat

entry.def: If you bear something somewhere, you carry it there or take it there.

example.ex: They bore the oblong hardwood box into the kitchen and put it on the table.
example.tran: 他们把那个长方形的硬木箱抬进厨房，放到桌上。

entry.def: If you bear something such as a weapon, you hold it or carry it with you.

example.ex: ...the constitutional right to bear arms.
example.tran: 宪法规定的携带武器的权利

entry.def: If one thing bears the weight of something else, it supports the weight of that thing.

example.ex: The ice was not thick enough to bear the weight of marching men.
example.tran: 冰不够厚，承载不了行军队伍的重量。

entry.def: If something bears a particular mark or characteristic, it has that mark or characteristic.

example.ex: The houses bear the marks of bullet holes.
example.tran: 房子上散布着弹孔。

example.ex: ...note paper bearing the Presidential seal...
example.tran: 盖有总统印章的便笺

entry.tran: 忍受，容忍，忍耐（不愉快经历）
entry.def: If you bear an unpleasant experience, you accept it because you are unable to do anything about it.

example.ex: They will have to bear the misery of living in constant fear of war...
example.tran: 他们不得不忍受长期生活在战争恐惧中的痛苦。

example.ex: He bore his sufferings manfully.
example.tran: 他勇敢地面对苦难。

entry.def: If you can't bear someone or something, you dislike them very much.

example.ex: I can't bear people who make judgements and label me...
example.tran: 我讨厌人们对我品头论足。

example.ex: I can't bear having to think what  I'm going to say...
example.tran: 我不愿意考虑将要说什么话。

entry.def: If someone bears the cost of something, they pay for it.

example.ex: Patients should not have to bear the costs of their own treatment.
example.tran: 病人不应该自己承担治疗费用。

entry.def: If you bear the responsibility for something, you accept responsibility for it.

example.ex: If a woman makes a decision to have a child alone, she should bear that responsibility alone.
example.tran: 如果一个女人决定独自抚养孩子，她就必须独自承担所有责任。

entry.tran: 带有，具有（相似之处）；有（关系等）
entry.def: If one thing bears no resemblance or no relationship to another thing, they are not at all similar.

example.ex: Their daily menus bore no resemblance whatsoever to what they were actually fed...
example.tran: 他们每天的食谱和他们实际吃到的东西完全不同。

example.ex: For many software packages, the price bears little relation to cost.
example.tran: 对于很多软件包来说，价钱和成本没有什么联系。

entry.def: When a plant or tree bears flowers, fruit, or leaves, it produces them.

example.ex: As the plants grow and start to bear fruit they will need a lot of water.
example.tran: 当植物生长并开始结果的时候，它们需要大量的水。

entry.def: If something such as a bank account or an investment bears interest, interest is paid on it.

example.ex: The eight-year bond will bear annual interest of 10.5%.
example.tran: 这种8年期的债券年利率为10.5%。

entry.def: When a woman bears a child, she gives birth to him or her.

example.ex: Emma bore a son called Karl...
example.tran: 埃玛生了个儿子叫卡尔。

example.ex: She bore him a daughter, Suzanna.
example.tran: 她给他生了个女儿，苏珊娜。

entry.def: If you bear someone a feeling such as love or hate, you feel that emotion towards them.

example.ex: She bore no ill will. If people didn't like her, too bad...
example.tran: 她没有恶意。如果人们不喜欢她，那就太糟糕了。

example.ex: I have lived with him on the best terms and bear him friendship.
example.tran: 我跟他住在一起，相处得非常不错，我把他当好朋友。

entry.def: If you bear yourself in a particular way, you move or behave in that way.

example.ex: There was elegance and simple dignity in the way he bore himself.
example.tran: 他举止优雅而庄重。

entry.def: If you bear left or bear right when you are driving or walking along, you turn and continue in that direction.

example.ex: Go left onto the A107 and bear left into Seven Sisters Road.
example.tran: 向左驶入A107号公路,然后左转进七姐妹路。

entry.def: If you bring something to bear on a situation, you use it to deal with that situation.

example.ex: British scientists have brought computer science to bear on this problem.
example.tran: 英国的科学家们已经应用计算机科学来解决这个问题。

entry.def: If you bring pressure or influence to bear on someone, you use it to try and persuade them to do something.

example.ex: His companions brought pressure to bear on him, urging him to stop wasting money.
example.tran: 他的伙伴们给他施加压力，劝他不要再浪费钱。

entry.def: A bear is a large, strong wild animal with thick fur and sharp claws.
On the stock market, bears are people who sell shares in expectation of a drop in price, in order to make a profit by buying them back again after a short time.

means.word_mean: 1. massive plantigrade carnivorous or omnivorous mammals with long shaggy coats and strong claws
2. an investor with a pessimistic market outlook; an investor who expects prices to fall and so sells now in order to buy later at a lower price
1. have;
2. give birth (to a newborn);
3. put up with something or somebody unpleasant;

sentences.sentence: "The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks"
"She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage"

means.word_mean: 4. move while holding up or supporting;
5. bring forth, "The apple tree bore delicious apples this year";
6. take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person;
7. contain or hold; have within;
8. bring in;

sentences.sentence: "How much does this savings certificate pay annually?"

means.word_mean: 9. have on one's person;
10. behave in a certain manner;

sentences.sentence: "They conducted themselves well during these difficult times"

means.word_mean: 11. have rightfully; of rights, titles, and offices;

sentences.sentence: "He held the governorship for almost a decade"

means.word_mean: 12. support or hold in a certain manner;
13. be pregnant with;

sentences.sentence: "The are expecting another child in January"

abbreviation.mean_cn: 承受，承重，无线电方位，方位角，矿脉走向，轴承

Sentence.sentence: I couldn't bear to spend three hours sitting in a train every day.
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men
Bear the cost of publicising the Company's performance.
Maybe we need to bear in bear in mind that the right obstacles help lead us to greater achievements.

means.word_mean: 传达，传递，传播，散布(流言蜚语等)

sentences.en: She bore gossips.

means.word_mean: 成功地经受，经受住，经得住，经得起(考验等)，耐得住

sentences.en: Her claim can bear close examination.
sentences.cn: 她的要求经得起仔细检查。

means.word_mean: 推动，推进，猛推；推挤，挤压；驱赶；冲

sentences.en: The demonstrators were borne back by the police.
sentences.cn: 示威者被警察驱赶回去了。

means.word_mean: 使(头部、身体等)保持某种状态

sentences.en: The boy bears himself erectly.

means.word_mean: 需要；要求；容许；有…的余地

sentences.en: This matter bears investigation.

means.word_mean: 产生(某种结果)[只用于被动语态]

sentences.en: The traffic accident was born almost accidentally.
sentences.cn: 这个交通事故的发生几乎纯属偶然。

means.word_mean: 承担, 负担

sentences.en: His shoulders can bear a heavy load.
A camel can bear burden.
Three helping one another bear the burden of six.
sentences.cn: 三人互相帮忙, 能挑得起六个人的担子。

sentences.en: This beam bears the whole weight of the upper floor.
sentences.cn: 这根大梁承受了上面那一层的全部重量。

sentences.en: The delicate handicraft works will not bear rough handling.
sentences.cn: 精致的手工艺品经不起粗鲁的摆弄。

sentences.en: The ice is too thin to bear your weight.
sentences.cn: 冰太薄, 承受不了你的重量。

means.word_mean: 忍受, 容忍

sentences.en: She was unable to bear.
I can't bear to see you like this.
Oh, I can't bear to think of it!
sentences.cn: 啊, 我简直不忍心去想它。

sentences.en: She couldn't bear to turn around again.
She couldn't bear to see others suffer.
She couldn't bear to see animals treated cruelly.
I cannot bear to leave him alone.
sentences.cn: 我不忍心让他独自留下。

sentences.en: He can't bear to be laughed at.
She can't bear to watch them suffer.
Can you bear hearing about it again?
sentences.cn: 再听到这种事情, 你能容忍吗?

sentences.en: He could not bear that his friends should laugh at him.
sentences.cn: 他受不了朋友们的嘲笑。

sentences.en: He could not bear that they should be so conceited.
sentences.cn: 他受不了他们这样自高自大。

sentences.en: I couldn't bear that Mother should scold me in the face of my friends.
sentences.cn: 母亲当着我朋友们的面骂我, 我受不了。

sentences.en: I can't bear him to do this.
sentences.cn: 我不能容忍他做这种事。

sentences.en: The old man can't bear anyone in the family to oppose him.
sentences.cn: 这位老人绝不能容忍家里有人违抗他。

sentences.en: She could not bear me to be away.

means.word_mean: 生(孩子); 结(果实)

sentences.en: This tree bears well.
Some of the new planted apple orchards have also begun to bear.
sentences.cn: 有些新开的苹果园也开始结苹果了。

sentences.en: The peach tree bears well.
The peach trees are not going to bear well this year.

means.word_mean: 熊；笨拙的人；【美】【俚】佼佼者

sentences.en: He is a bear at mathematics.

means.word_mean: (向特定方向)移动，朝向，(朝某一方向)延伸；行进；去；拐弯

sentences.en: Bear left at the traffic light.

means.word_mean: 指向，朝向，对准；瞄准；正对…方向(与on或upon连用)

sentences.en: The gun doesn't bear on the mark.

means.word_mean: 与…有关，关于，涉及；对…有影响 (常与on或upon连用)

sentences.en: This information bears strongly on the matter under discussion.
sentences.cn: 这消息对正在讨论中的事情产生很大影响。

means.word_mean: 压迫；重压；压；挤；用力推(常与on，upon连用)

sentences.en: Grief bears heavily on her.
